alert.note: Alert for Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 8:19PM PST until January 15 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches, except 3 to 5 inches above 5,000 feet. Lowest valleys below 4500 feet will generally see 1 inch or less. * WHERE...Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall is currently focused from Washoe Valley southward to the US-395 NV/CA border. Another area of light to moderate precipitation is working its way eastward over the Sierra, and should move into Washoe county by 10 PM. Slick and icy roads can be anticipated overnight.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
